result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Stewart Jr

defendant.name: Stewart, James, Jr
defendant.address: 126 1/2 E Blackhawk Avenue Apt 9, Prairie du Chien, WI 53821

records.addlTxt: Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement. Defendant shall have no contact with Alicia Garduno.

1:49 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant James Stewart Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for James Stewart Jr.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Erickson is heard. Defendant waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count. 

Attorney Erickson comments on a letter that was received from defendants probation agent, Judge will be granting defendant a further stay upon Attorney Erickson's petition. Attorney Erickson comments that the Judge will be granting a further stay for defendant to get out to look for work. Asking for bond modification for defendant to do this. 

Attorney Erickson is heard on bond modification request. Requests signature bond or a lower cash bond. 
Court approves a modification of the bond to a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement. Defendant shall have no contact with Alicia Garduno.

Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on December 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
10/10/22 DOC P & P Ltr. RE: Def. status on probation - James Stewart

3:19 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant James Stewart Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for James Stewart Jr.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Counsel states they are prepared to proceed with preliminary hearing 

1W - CASEY COX - Sworn
exam. by Atty. Steiner 
record reflects identification of defendant by witness
cross exam by Atty. Erickson
State requests bind over.
Atty. Erickson objects to bind over

Court finds probable cause and binds def over for further proceedings. 

Atty Erickson requests another date for Arraignment and wishes to be heard on bond
Court schedules Arraignment of Oct. 12, 2022 at 1:30 PM

Atty. Erickson requests bond be modified to signature bond, or cash bond be reduced, def. will still be in custody, but could be released on Huber.
Court will address the bond modification at the arraignment. Judge wants clarification on the ATR
response by Atty Erickson.
comments by Defendant - requests bond be lowered. 

Court adjourns this matter. Would like something from the probation/parole agent re: def's status
Arraignment scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Completion - Attorney Charlotte Wynes
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson

records.addlTxt: Court takes no action; directs letter be scanned to both Thomas Wiemerslage & James Stewart cases.

1:45 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant James Stewart Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Charlotte M Wynes in court for James Stewart Jr.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  
Defendant is heard.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 4, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

1:09 PM Defendant James Stewart appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Charlotte M Wynes in court for James Stewart.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

State is heard, will be filing a criminal complaint, needs one more week. 

Attorney Charlotte Wynes is heard.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:31 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant James Stewart appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Charlotte Wynes appeared via video for defendant. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a $1,500.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with Alicia Garduno. 

Attorney Wynes is heard and requests a signature bond or a lower cash bond. 

Court orders a $1,000.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with Alicia Garduno. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. Defendant shall have no contact with Alicia Garduno.
Bail/bond hearing on September 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
